Direct Class

Uses
  • handleEvents
Extends Link
Defined in: src/link/direct.js:5

A port providing message transport between two freedom contexts in the same namespace. Note that using a direct link does not provide the isolation that freedom.js encourages. To that end it should be limited to a method for testing and not used in production without some serious though about the implications of that decision.

Defined in src/link/direct.js:5

(

)

Defined in src/link/direct.js:61

Receive messages from the hub to this port. Received messages will be emitted from the other side of the port.

    the channel/flow of the message.

Inherited from handleEvents: src/util.js:194

Register a method to be executed when an event of a specific type occurs.

(
  • type
  • handler
)

Inherited from handleEvents: src/util.js:202

Register a method to be execute the next time an event occurs.

Parameters:

  • type String | Function

    The type of event to wait for.

  • handler Function

    The handler to run the next time a matching event is raised.

Array

Inherited from handleEvents but overwritten in src/util.js:154

Filter a list based on a predicate. The list is filtered in place, with selected items removed and returned by the function.

Parameters:

  • predicate Function
